title: 107_hr3362
content: The Act may be cited as the "Transported Air Pollution Mitigation Act of 2001" and includes SIP requirements for areas upwind of ozone nonattainment areas. The Clean Air Act is amended to require upwind areas to reduce emissions of ozone or its precursors if they contribute to violations of air quality standards in downwind areas. The Clean Air Act is amended to require upwind areas to reduce emissions of ozone or its precursors if they contribute to violations of air quality standards in downwind areas. For moderate ozone nonattainment areas, the State may require payments from upwind areas to compensate for emission reduction measures in downwind areas. The Clean Air Act amendment requires upwind areas to reduce emissions if they contribute to air quality violations in downwind areas. States must submit a revised plan within 1 year for an enhanced vehicle inspection and maintenance program. SEC. 3. SIP requirements for states upwind of ozone nonattainment areas. SIP revisions are required for upwind States that contribute to ozone nonattainment in downwind areas, with provisions for emission reductions determined necessary by the Administrator. The Administrator may require upwind States to make payments to downwind States for emission reduction measures necessary to mitigate ozone pollution. The Clean Air Act is amended to require states to submit a plan for an enhanced vehicle inspection and maintenance program in areas contributing to ozone pollution in downwind areas. The Clean Air Act is amended to require states to submit a plan for an enhanced vehicle inspection and maintenance program in areas contributing to ozone pollution in downwind areas. This includes maintenance plans. The Clean Air Act now mandates states to update maintenance plans within a year of certain events to include measures for an enhanced vehicle inspection and maintenance program in areas causing ozone pollution in downwind areas. The Clean Air Act requires states to update maintenance plans within a year to include measures for reducing ozone pollution in downwind areas caused by upwind areas designated as attainment areas. The Clean Air Act mandates that states must include all measures from the State implementation plan for upwind areas in attainment areas to mitigate ozone transport to downwind areas, without relaxing or rescinding any control measures.
